    "period": "Roman Empire period",
    "period_reasoning": "The play is titled 'Le martyre de sainte Reyne d'Alise' (The martyrdom of Saint Reyne of Alise). Saint Reyne (or Regina) of Alise was a Christian martyr who, according to tradition, was persecuted and martyred during the Roman persecution of Christians in the 3rd century CE under Emperor Decius or Maximian.",
    "timeframe_start": "0250",
    "timeframe_end": "0304",
    "location": "Alise-Sainte-Reine (ancient Alesia), Burgundy, France",
    "location_reasoning": "The title explicitly mentions 'sainte Reyne d'Alise' which refers to Saint Regina (Reyne) of Alise. Alise refers to Alise-Sainte-Reine, a commune in Burgundy, France, which was the ancient Gallo-Roman settlement of Alesia. The play was composed by a religious figure from the abbey of Flavigny, which is where the saint's relics were kept ('où repose le corps de sainte Reine').",
